comment: Spanish for criminal justice you might want to take someone else. I had a higher grade in college Spanish 2 than this class. She is a legal translator and expects perfection, moves fast. All the other students were failing and she was confused why. She is very nice and you can get an A just a miserable class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I have never enjoyed a FL class like I did this one. Professor Cruz is a great teacher, and she is willing to help if you ask. I took 5 years of Spanish prior to taking this class and learned lots. There are speaking assignments, but she's very helpful before and during the presentations. Would recommend, especially if you've never taken Spanish
Really passionate about teaching and caring and knows her stuff. Come to class and you should do fine.

Professor Cruz_Abazeri's class was always fun and she was always willing to work with students to make sure they did as well as possible. The 1001 class was not difficult and I will be taking her 1002 class

Mrs. Cruz is an amazing Spanish teacher. She is the best Spanish teacher I've ever had as she really cares that you learn the language, has very clear lectures and knows the grammar very well. As long as you come to class and are engaged, she is very understanding and will work with you if you try. If you ask for help, she is there to give it.

She is extremely knowledgeable in the subject. Her accent can be slightly hard to understand at times, but you quickly get used to it. Her class does have online homework which was sometimes problematic due to technical issues. She was a very great professor and I am planning to take her again for SPAN 1002 next semester.

She used to work at tech so she takes this class seriously. It's obvious she's very passionate about teaching and if you come to class and pay attention you should get an A. If you need help and take the time to ask she is very caring to explain. Hardish tests but the department makes all the tests. One of the most inspiring teachers i've had.
